column4: hi, I have a strange problem, I was wondering if anyone might have any ideas. Im running ubuntu server 10.10 and if I use bash I cant type lower case e in console. Only way around was changing from bash to bin/sh.. but in sh I cant use the lowercase e in programs like lftp.
what do you get instead of an e ?
nothing, just a error message from putty.. like im trying to paste a blank cliboard
so this happens on putty. not in a xterminal nor the console tty's. looks like a putty conffiguration issue
its the same when im logged on to the server itself
but I changed my used to use zsh, and I can use e now (as you can see), but lftp wont let me type it
you may want to check "sudo dpkg-reconfigure console-setup" and see if everythng is ok

ive done it several times, checked every setting and compared to another server it works on, still no go.. it seems like the letter e in lowercase is somehow changed to do a different function.. I can not figure out where and what
:/ well i really dunno; it is weird that it wrks in zsh but not in bash
if all terminal apps failed the same way ...
because it also works in your irc client but not in lftp :( inconsistencies hard to explain
in bash everything fails... in zsh i havent had any problems untill now, when I tried to use lftp
maybe the exported $TERM var in bash ?
